required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Apatinib Treating Patients With Advanced Cervical Cancer After Radiotherapy and First-line Chemotherapy.
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Study of Apatinib Mesylate in the Treatment of Advanced Cervical Cancer After Radiotherapy and First-line Chemotherapy.

brief_summary.textblock: To Observe and Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Apatinib in Patients With Advanced Cervical Cancer After Radiotherapy and First-line Chemotherapy.

detailed_description.textblock: Eligible patients will receive apatinib treatment until disease progression or intolerable toxicity or patients withdrawal of consent after the failure of chemotherapy or radiotherapy.

primary_outcome.measure: Apatinib treating patients with advanced cervical cancer after radiotherapy and first-line chemotherapy.
primary_outcome.description: The time from the beginning of treatment to observing the progression of the disease or the death of any cause.

intervention.description: Apatinib 500mg/d po,28 days as one cycle
